channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Judge blocks suspension of Snap food aid during shutdown – US politics live
item.description: Federal court ruling comes hours before more than 40 million Americans could lose food stamps benefits Trump officials blocked from suspending Snap be...

item.title: Palace’s statement on Andrew is ‘vindication’ for Virginia Giuffre, says her family
item.description: Women’s rights groups say announcement sends important message to survivors of abuse The historic statement from Buckingham Palace stripping Andrew Mo...

item.title: Nexperia halts chip supplies to China in threat to global car production

item.title: M&S launches ‘secret support’ pants that offer men a ‘subtle lift’

item.title: Trump administration blocked from suspending Snap benefits for millions of Americans

item.title: Former England goalkeeper Mary Earps announces 'happy' same-sex relationship
item.description: Earps has been supported and encouraged by her former Lionesses teammates to open up about her sexuality.

item.title: Why Sarah Ferguson, Beatrice and Eugenie can't escape the taint of family scandal
item.description: The scandal engulfing Andrew is of his own making but has had a profound impact on his immediate family.

item.title: 'No inch here was spared': Hurricane Melissa destroys Jamaica town
item.description: The BBC’s Nada Tawfik reports from Black River, where the strongest storm to hit the country in modern history has left scenes of desperation.

item.title: Former England keeper Earps announces 'happy' same-sex relationship
item.description: Earps has been supported and encouraged by her former Lionesses teammates to open up about her sexuality.

item.title: Several hundred feared dead as Tanzania election protests continue
item.description: A diplomatic source tells the BBC there is credible evidence that at least 500 people had died.
